Posts.Content: My bcn is fabulous and the ladies she works with are as well, I get phone calls regularly and she knows exactly what is going on with me, today she came and found me to sort out my sick note as I was supposed to go and see her but I was ages on the ward so she came to find me. After reading everyone else's post I sound a bit smug but I really cannot sing the praises enough. Not sure if it is because I am under Rotherham which is a subsidiary of weston Park hospital in Sheffield and they are such a small unit but you would think they would all work similarly but I assume Ali owl is under weston Park as she is a Sheffield girl and her posting would suggest otherwise. Sorry you guys that aren't getting the support they should be getting, suggest you all move to Rotherham although we haven't particularly got a good reputation as a town at the moment
Posts.Title: BCN

Posts.Content: Oh fantastic news and we'll done you, big cheers coming your way from south Yorkshire xxx
Posts.Title: Last radiotherapy session done and ticked off - yay!

Posts.Content: I had the pleasure of going there a couple of Fridays ago, and wowzer I am quite glad that I don't have to go there regularly, it was manic, although got to go there for my radiotherapy booo xxx
Posts.Title: BCN

Posts.Content: What a lovely positive post, thank you for that x
Posts.Title: I am a survivor!!

Posts.Content: Way to go you, thinking of going for that threading thing myself as my eyebrows are well weird now! X
Posts.Title: Nice appointments!

Posts.Content: lol Ali, won't be long before they are back, I have got very fine hairs above my eyebrows so it looks like I have got a separate blonde mono brow going on but you can only actually see it if the light is shining in the right direction.  All very bizarre, nobody has actually said anything, but I know it is there!
Posts.Title: Nice appointments!

Posts.Content: As far as I understand it, and I am no expert but this is the nodes nearest to the cancer. I had the first 3 or 4 taken, they then test this to see if the cancer has gone into your nodes. Good luck tomorrow xx
Posts.Title: what is sentinal node biopsy?

Posts.Content: Woohoo I actually know a little something amazing!
Posts.Title: what is sentinal node biopsy?

Posts.Content: Happy birthday lovely lady, hope you have had a wonderful spiffing day xxxxxxxxxxxx
Posts.Title: HAPPY BIRTHDAY

Posts.Content: Hi Milly, wow, you are going through it aren't you?  You don't have to be positive and don't feel you have to be brave or strong or anything else, you are going through a really tough time and you are allowed to concentrate on you and stop worrying about everyone else.  I know it is hard to do that as we are normally not programmed to think about ourselves but I will be honest and tell you that you need all your strength to deal with the journey you have started and you will not have anything spare to care for everyone round you like you normally would.  Don't bottle things up and don't hide them either, your hubby will know that you are doing this and that will be hard for him too, let him look after you.  I cannot comment on your side effects as I have not been prescribed the same meds you are on, but I am sure someone will be along shortly to advise.  It may be all the upset that has triggered your tummy, stress can do this. Sending you a massive big hug and a little x
Posts.Title: feeling so negative now after feeling so positive

Posts.Content: I don't know a great deal about much, but I did ask if they could tell whether my bc was secondary and they told me that they can tell from the cells whether they are breast cells or have originated elsewhere and travelled so I assume if yours weren't originally breast cells they would have told you before now, good luck lovely, I will be keeping my fingers crossed for you xx
Posts.Title: Need some help here girls....

Posts.Content: Look at you fantastic lady, you and your daughters should be very proud of yourselves xxx
Posts.Title: Race for Life done and dusted ....

Posts.Content: What are we like, worse thing is hubby came with me when surgeon explained and I didn't listen then took my son with me to meet my bcn and she went through it again and I didn't listen then either, it was only when we were having tea and I said about how fantastic it was that they could not get rid of my lump under local anaesthetic and hook it out with a wire and I got two quizzical looks off them two that I found out what was really involved!
Posts.Title: mammogram before op

Posts.Content: ditto what Jobey said, I had mine put in the morning of my op as well, although when they told me they were putting a wire in to mark where the invader was, I wasn't actually listening really and was convinced that they were removing the lump with the wire (don't even ask, it wouldn't even make sense that they would do that to a 10 year old!!!!).  Don't you be worrying Ali, just think, this time tomorrow, your invader will be no more YAAAAAAAAAY xxxxxxx
Posts.Title: mammogram before op

Posts.Content: I would give your oncologists secretary a call as this isn't really acceptable in my opinion, all treatment should be given with due consultation to yourself and this hasn't happened xx let us know how you go
Posts.Title: Not having full FEC moved into T

Posts.Content: And another, my mum had bc at 50 and never had reoccurrence, my aunt also had it and didn't have reoccurrence, both lived full and happy lives xx
Posts.Title: Diagnosed with breast cancer Nov 14'. Lumpectomy no spread in lymph...

Posts.Content: Going into the unknown is scary, I had my 3rd chemo yesterday so halfway through yey, the chemo nurses are absolutely brilliant and will give you all the information you will need. We are all here for you as well so don't be afraid to ask or just let off how you are feeling. What I would suggest you do is keep a diary of every thing you are feeling symptom wise because I noticed a bit of a pattern but wished I had kept a record as my brain is a bit bleugh so I have been very much "did I have this last session" and I kept having eureka moments of wow I had this last session as well and I think that gives you reassurance when it is similar but that is just m,  try not to worry, you will get through this xxx
Posts.Title: going for my chemo chat today

Posts.Content: Left one coming out in sympathy for right one? No idea hun but I would deffo ring gp in Case you have An infection Ps excuse the  Stupid capitals my phone is being naughty again xx.
Posts.Title: 72 hours since lumpectomy right breast....why does left one hurt?

Posts.Content: fantastic news, so so pleased for you xxx
Posts.Title: Fantastic News!

Posts.Content: Sugar free sweets are supposed to have a laxative effect and as they are sugar free you don't have to worry about gaining weight.
Posts.Title: Endgame!!

Posts.Content: Sugar free sweets are supposed to have a laxative effect and as they are sugar free you don't have to worry about gaining weight.
Posts.Title: Endgame!!

Posts.Content: I am not quite sure whether I am having hot flushes or it is in fact just me sweating but as I havent got any hair to dispense it so to speak, it is just sat there with nowhere to go. Has/is anyone else experiencing this? X
Posts.Title: hot flush or just because I am bald

Posts.Content: I am quite confused by it because I am 43 and my periods haven't actually stopped which is the one side effect from chemo that I was actually looking forward to so I don't really know where I am with it, I suppose it is just a case of waiting and seeing what happens Glad to know it isn't just me ladies, I have been completely weird and random with things throughout this pig of a disease to the point that even my bcn has gone ooh never heard of that so it is actually nice to be in the pool of normal instead of being on the highest diving board by myself xx
Posts.Title: hot flush or just because I am bald

Posts.Content: Definitely yes, even if it isn't cording you are always better getting things like this diagnosed sooner rather than later, try not to worry, your bcn should be able to direct you to get this sorted, phone them today xxxx
Posts.Title: Painful cording

Posts.Content: Hi kerryjane, I stopped after 3 due to the side effects I had, this was not a decision I took lightly and didn't make the choice until I had the facts and figures from my oncologist. I spoke to my family in depth and had the support of my bcn who was truly wonderful and supportive. For me, the difference in benefit was minimal (in my opinion) as the onc said the damage was now outweighing the benefits. Speak to your bcn and your onc as they will be able to assist you in making an informed decision, you need to be ok with the choices you make. Good luck and be well xxx
Posts.Title: Advice / Feedback please on stopping chemo

Posts.Content: Hi hun, sending you a big hug, please be assured this is a natural reaction, I think everyone that has come through the other side of chemo can relate to what you are feeling. You are doing really well and you are nearly there lovey. You are probably right that it is because it is easter, I think it reminds you of how utterly pants this thing is and how much of your life it consumes.Xxx
Posts.Title: Hit a brick wall

Posts.Content: Had 3 lots of fec but had meeting with oncologist last week and because of a huge amount of problems, I won't be having any further chemo, just waiting to start radiotherapy now x
Posts.Title: hot flush or just because I am bald

Posts.Content: fabulous, well done you for crossing that good old finishing line.  Victory dance has now commenced xxx
Posts.Title: Said my goodbyes

Posts.Content: Well done you guys, I started back at yoga a month ago and actually managed the majority of the session this week without having to sit out (still crap at being a tree though) xx
Posts.Title: gym

Posts.Content: Positive thinking lovely, instead of 3 were positive, you should be thinking fab, 2 were clear. It really does help finding the good out of every situation, big hugs xxx
Posts.Title: Sentinel node - what is it exactly????

Posts.Content: That's fabulous news, oh to start living a normal life x
Posts.Title: yahooo

Posts.Content: that all sounds pretty fabulous in the grand scheme of things so fantastic news on that Amber xxxx
Posts.Title: Dreading results

Posts.Content: Way to go Ali, what a fantastic week this is.  Victory dance underway. xxxxxxxxxxxxxxx
Posts.Title: Another Neddy passes the finish post!

Posts.Content: twit twoo, look at you doing your thing xx
Posts.Title: Took the plunge and went to hairdressers today ...

Posts.Content: Oh well done little susie, BEST WEEK EVER xx
Posts.Title: Another Neddy passes the finish post!

Posts.Content: Oh sweetheart, what an appalling place you are in, I cannot possibly answer you but I am sure our wonderful club will have some answers, I would seriously consider ringing your bcn, just to get some immediate relief or answers, in the meantime here is a big huge hug and know that I am sending you every good vibe I can muster xxxxxx
Posts.Title: reacurrance

Posts.Content: Woohoo, glad they are working ladies,  I was going to get some myself as I thought the chemo had deffo set off menopause, but guess what turned up this week!
Posts.Title: menopause the solution

Posts.Content: thats good news Pat, although when I saw the heading of your post I did initially think, wow, can we claim tax back if we have had cancer.  That would be blooming well marvellous, though your good news did cheer me up nearly as much as a tax rebate xx
Posts.Title: Tax reduction

Posts.Content: Oh fiona, I do feel for you, unfortunately 5 year olds are really not the best at being diplomatic are they?  I am sure when she is 18 she will be glad to still have her grandma around. Isn't there anyone than can look after her for the few days after your chemo, it really does start improving after the first 4 or 5 days of feeling Pants , keep your chin up hun, you are nearly there xxxx
Posts.Title: Completely fed up

Posts.Content: Fab that you have started on the last bit before the finish line, it's a good feeling isn't it? Try and air the area as much as possible, obviously not full on topless when you go to the shops as that may cause a bit of a stir! Lol xxx
Posts.Title: Finally started radiotherapy

Posts.Content: been waiting for this post for ages, fantastic news.  You do realise you will now have started an avalanche of people dying their hair?  Think I will be able to hear Ali Owl woohooing from the other side of Sheffield when she reads this lol xx
Posts.Title: hair dye the sequel

Posts.Content: Hi bambi I am four weeks post rads and my skin is starting to look more normal but only just. With regards to nipple, I had an enormous amount of pain, and it just wasn't right at all following rads but that is also nearly back to normal. My bcn said it was probably just because rads mess your boob up again so it takes time to settle down again xx
Posts.Title: Breast skin after radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Cannot really say anything apart from we are here for you and have an abundance of hugs to send xxxxx
Posts.Title: cancer spread

Posts.Content: Fab news Wendy, onwards and upwards xx
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy done...Hoorah...Onward and upward ;-)

Posts.Content: that is a bit of a bugger, big hugs to you and hubby xx
Posts.Title: Here we go again.

Posts.Content: I would get it checked just to reassure yourself but to maybe ease your mind a little my onc and bcn both told me that radiotherapy mixes everything up cell wise (or something like that) and it can take 6 to 12 months for the area to normalise again so pain is probably things knitting themselves back to how they should be
Posts.Title: New pain under arm

Posts.Content: Ooh noo Mrs pat, sending you a major big hug to help xxx
Posts.Title: Hi there ladies.

Posts.Content: Hi rob, the reality is you have cancer, where it is isn't really relevant, the fact remains that you are going through a very traumatic treatment regime and you do get to the point of having had enough because it makes you feel so awful. It is natural to want to protect your family and pushing them away is probably the most logical thing you can do but in reality, they love you and pushing them away will only make them feel worse so you aren't really protecting them and actually you cannot really protect them because this journey is necessary to get to the other side. I cannot say that I know how you are feeling, but I can tell you that you shouldn't have any reason to feel embarrassed, you didn't ask for this did you? Sending you a big hug, I do think that you need to "vent your spleen" and here is the perfect way to do it. Be safe x
Posts.Title: I can no longer cope

Posts.Content: lol Ali, know what you mean, I thought everyone had fallen out with me and then my inbox has just exploded so that was nice
Posts.Title: Not receiving emails from Macmillan/ who's a pretty. boy!!

Posts.Content: Fan blooming tastic xxxx
Posts.Title: Yippeeeeeee

Posts.Content: Hi jo just want to give you reassurance that whatever you don't ask the onc, you can always ask the nurses on the chemo unit, they tend to know more about what you will be going through than the oncologist and I don't mean that to sound disrespectful you will also be seeing your onc regularly throughout and you can always ask your bcn or us so what I am trying to say is don't stress yourself about forgetting to ask something. I didn't do cold cap either, it really is whatever you feel best with, losing your hair isn't the end of the world, and there are bonuses (saving on hair products, less time in the shower, don't need to use an extra towel to dry your head). Good luck tomorrow, you will be fine xxx you also might want to try breathing techniques when you got to bed, this should help you relax and concentrate your mind on your breathing rather than tomorrow, deep breath in then twice as long to breath out (if that makes Sense)
Posts.Title: Meet oncologist tomorrow re treatment plan

Posts.Content: It does go, I looked like a poor imitation of santa and was absolutely convinced the cats were covering me in cotton wool whilst I slept but it's gone now. I just have to put up with the ooh it's all curly comments in reference to my hair and I have also been told my hair looks like the ears of a spaniel, not even once ladies been told it twice!
Posts.Title: I'm growing a hairy,furry face!!!

Posts.Content: Hi dandy, might be wise to post this as a new thread, I have had continuous watery eyes but they don't know if it is the chemo or whether it is from the bells palsy that started just after my first chemo session, all I do know is it is sending me round the twist having watering sore eyes all the time xx
Posts.Title: Mastectomy on Monday and really scared!

Posts.Content: Having any op is nerve wracking and especially one so big as this so it is not surprising you are feeling jittery, please be assured that your anesthetist (apologies if that isn't spelt right, it doesn't look right!) is there to look after you and make sure your pain is managed as well as the rest of the team, they will do everything to make sure you are looked after. If you are not up to coming home they won't let you, they have a duty of care to you and do take this seriously, more than likely if you come home, all you will want to do is sleep, especially with the medication they will have given you Xx
Posts.Title: Mastectomy on Monday and really scared!

Posts.Content: Blooming marvellous news, today just keeps getting better x
Posts.Title: Good news! Mum got the all clear after surgery!

Posts.Content: Also to chrissie, hope everything went OK today and we see you back on here soon xx
Posts.Title: Mastectomy on Monday and really scared!

Posts.Content: Victory dance being done for you grannylara, will do another after 2 on Friday for you littlesusie woop woop x
Posts.Title: I've only gone and done it !!

Posts.Content: Thanks everyone, glad I am not smurfing it by myself x
Posts.Title: blue boobs

Posts.Content: Just out of interest how long did it take for the blue dye to disappear as I had my op on 18 December and I still resemble a smurf
Posts.Title: blue boobs

Posts.Content: Hi Jenny I believe they have to be careful what they use on you, haven't you got a support centre in your area that offer's massages?  I only ask because I was told by my BCN nurse that the local cancer care charity for my area would give me massages and treatments for free during my treatment for cancer and then when I went for Radiotherapy (at a different hospital), the cancer care centre there also offered different treatments.  I do empathise with you about talking to medical staff, I absolutely appreciate everything they have done for me but I was mighty pleased when I didn't actually have to talk to anybody within the medical profession for the whole month of May, it was exceedingly delightful!!
Posts.Title: Massage

Posts.Content: Woop flipping doodly doo that is fabulous news xxxxx
Posts.Title: Result of first mammogram today ...

Posts.Content: Just to make you lol, I read the header as peeing like a snake not peeling so definitely peeked my curiosity!
Posts.Title: Peeling like a snake!!

Posts.Content: Superb news x
Posts.Title: breast clinic tomorow im worried sick

Posts.Content: Mine started falling out day 12 and I ended up shaving it all off at the weekend. Just washed my covering (don't think it is really long enough to be called hair) but had a laugh in the bath as I didn't know whether to use shampoo that would give me a tousled look or use youth defying products, sorry, it might be my weird sense of humour both made me laugh but I went for the tousled one in the end lol.
Posts.Title: Hair Care before and after Chemo

Posts.Content: Woohoo absolutely fabulous xx
Posts.Title: surgery done. Nearing the end of this journey

Posts.Content: You poor love, what a lot you are having to deal with all at once, I wish there were word's that a could say that will alleviate your worry, all I can say is that you are being proactive in dealing with whatever this is by speaking to your bcn and I am sure they will get you checked as soon as possible. With regards to your recent bereavement the loss of a parent whatever age they are or you are are is devastating you are suddenly thrown into a zone of not having that reassurance of the comfort of a parent, even if that caring responsibly has been reversed for years. The grieving process is necessary for your emotional and ultimately physical self to move forward.  I am no expert but have lost both parents and I can only speak from experience. There are fabulous people on here that will and can help and I will try and help as much as I can. This forum will show you that you don't have to go through this alone x
Posts.Title: advice please somebody

Posts.Content: Ooh Ali can you let me have the details of that, think I might need to make changes in how I deal with life and health and this might be perfect. Thank you for the original post and comments, it really makes you think xx
Posts.Title: A few tips from my Cancer Survivorship Course

Posts.Content: Oh Amanda, what a horrible time you are having right now.  I would definitely go to the support group of Tuesday as the more support you have , the better.  I would phone your onc's secretary and insist that you are seen, how utterly unfair to keep you in the dark like this, they must have some idea what is going on. Sending you a big huge hug ((())))))  xx
Posts.Title: Not sure where I belong anymore

Posts.Content: oh sweetheart, we have all been there, its a big bag of pants isn't it?  We are all here for you and chemo isn't so bad, the side effects aren't particularly nice but if it kills the cancer then that can only be good.  You have a good cry, there is no point keeping it in and here is a big huge hug to let you know that you aren't alone ((((())))))))) xxxxxxxx
Posts.Title: not having a good day :(

Posts.Content: oh sweetheart, we have all been there, its a big bag of pants isn't it?  We are all here for you and chemo isn't so bad, the side effects aren't particularly nice but if it kills the cancer then that can only be good.  You have a good cry, there is no point keeping it in and here is a big huge hug to let you know that you aren't alone ((((())))))))) xxxxxxxx
Posts.Title: not having a good day :(

Posts.Content: ditto what everyone else has said and sending you massive hugs xxxx
Posts.Title: Starting FEC T today

Posts.Content: Hi hun, how you feeling about that, it isn't nice to build yourself up to having chemo then not going ahead but it is better to be safe about these things so I hope you aren't feeling to bad, big hugs xxx
Posts.Title: no chemo today

Posts.Content: Hi ladies, my GP has prescribed me Dixarit tablets (clonidine hydrochloride), which is supposed to help with the hot flushes, got to say mine are a huge amount better though not sure if it is these tablets or my body getting used to the tamoxifen (only started on tamoxifen in April).   My joints are terrible and I have started taking glucosamine to try and help and my puffy ankles are a blooming nightmare.  Its all a big bag of pants if you ask me but it is better than being dead so I will shut up now xxx
Posts.Title: Side effects from Tamoxifen after nearly a year

Posts.Content: Hi ladies, my GP has prescribed me Dixarit tablets (clonidine hydrochloride), which is supposed to help with the hot flushes, got to say mine are a huge amount better though not sure if it is these tablets or my body getting used to the tamoxifen (only started on tamoxifen in April).   My joints are terrible and I have started taking glucosamine to try and help and my puffy ankles are a blooming nightmare.  Its all a big bag of pants if you ask me but it is better than being dead so I will shut up now xxx
Posts.Title: Side effects from Tamoxifen after nearly a year

Posts.Content: stop it Judith, I want a crunchie now, it doesn't take much to influence me, I am an advertiser's dream lol
Posts.Title: Diet & Chocolate for nutritional purposes ;-D

Posts.Content: Hi lovely, all these emotions are normal and healthy as they are all part of the grieving process. Take every day one day at a time, you will get there. Coroners inquest is very much like a court and he will go through the evidence then make a ruling,  there will be a coroners court that covers your area, so you should be able to Google it. Take care my friend, we are all with you xxxx
Posts.Title: Good days & bad days????

Posts.Content: I had swelling and it went down after a couple of weeks, think it is pretty normal to be honest as you and your body have gone through a pretty traumatic experienc.  My bcn told me to keep an eye on it in case of infection (which I got so week of aantibiotics) and to take pain relief, she said that I was going through enough and shouldn't have to put up with pain as well. I had ibuprofen and codeine which helped xx
Posts.Title: painful bruising after op

Posts.Content: me and you must be twins Ali Owl, I am also sat here eating galaxy chocolate and my favourite chocolate is Terry's chocolate orange, although I love all chocolate, it is kind of the rules to eat chocolate as it makes you happy xxxxxx
Posts.Title: Diet & Chocolate for nutritional purposes ;-D

Posts.Content: Sometimes when I feel like I have been naughty with the over eating I have chocolate buttons as they are only little pieces of chocolate so clearly don't have as many calories.
Posts.Title: Diet & Chocolate for nutritional purposes ;-D

Posts.Content: That's a good way of explaining it, it does feel like you are in a surreal bubble but it does get better xxx
Posts.Title: breast dancer er positive

Posts.Content: Love it, we ought to create a little collection of what kids say, the innocence and beauty in it is a sheer delight, although I must admit I didn't read it probably at the Beginning and was impressed and amused that a 5 year old would use such a grown up word, it was only when I saw the g & j's comment that I realised it said decreased not deceased so got two laughs for the price of one xx
Posts.Title: A smile to start today.

Posts.Content: Love it, we ought to create a little collection of what kids say, the innocence and beauty in it is a sheer delight, although I must admit I didn't read it probably at the Beginning and was impressed and amused that a 5 year old would use such a grown up word, it was only when I saw the g & j's comment that I realised it said decreased not deceased so got two laughs for the price of one xx
Posts.Title: A smile to start today.

Posts.Content: Oh well done for getting through and have a fab time with your new hair at the wedding xx
Posts.Title: Something good for a change

Posts.Content: Fantastic news xx
Posts.Title: survivor

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, currently having radiotherapy and got a swollen boob which I know is a side effect but does anyone know if it is an issue if I take ibuprofen? I haven't seen anything that says I shouldn't but no-one has actually said anything about takes tablets whilst having radiotherapy. as a bonus, my boobs aren't so lopsided in size now and it is looking quite pert x
Posts.Title: taking ibuprofen during radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Hi flower, I always think that something bad is bound to happen and once the bad thing is out of the way everything will be ok, sooooooo, you have had your bad thing I.e losing your bank card, so upwards and onwards from here. Will be thinking of you tomorrow xx
Posts.Title: Not Had A Good Day (apart from a special event talking about Cancer...

Posts.Content: I have 3 cats and they are a great source of comfort, you have to be careful with regards to claws catching you and cleaning up after them but the benefits far outweigh the risks. I do think however that you need to be clear with your boys that your pet is a family pet and that you need to share care as I think sometimes kids and other half's forget that, and you might not be up to full caring responsibilities on some days xxx
Posts.Title: Silly Question??

Posts.Content: ditto what Ali said and big hugs from me as well xx
Posts.Title: On the last leg of this horrid journey

Posts.Content: Fab news, I celebrated my picc line coming out with a nice long soak in a big bubble bath, such a party animal xx
Posts.Title: Freedom!

Posts.Content: And please don't blame me if it goes horribly wrong lol, I promise I will bring you chocolates if you end up in hospital xx
Posts.Title: sill question !!!!!!

Posts.Content: Ditto what everyone else has said, just wanted to let you know that we are all here for you and there is always someone that has experience, however much you feel alone, and you will, we have all been there, just remember we understand  Sending you a big hug xx
Posts.Title: Diagnosed yesterday...

Posts.Content: I would think it wouldn't do any harm as long as it hasn't had anybody else's manky feet in it. It's only like having a bath for your feet but with bubbles and nobbly bits xx
Posts.Title: sill question !!!!!!

Posts.Content: Woohoo fan blooming tastic, victory dance will now commenced xxxx
Posts.Title: I did it too!

Posts.Content: You definitely belong here sister snail, the support you give to people is absolutely fabulous. If you feel that you cannot move on from your own experience by visiting here then that is completely understandable, but please don't ever think that you don't belong xx. I have also seen the things on my news feed, I haven't watched the video but have seen the photo of the lady who is commenting about the coke can between the boobs and she appears very passionate about it, which if that helps her then good for her but I do appreciate that it may not be helpful to others. I think the problem with social media sites is people don't think about how postings impact others. I get upset seeing posts with animal abuse in them and will generally block people that share them, and whilst all of them are to raise awareness or out animal abusers, I don't want to see them so I completely understand where you are coming from x
Posts.Title: Is it just me ...

Posts.Content: I have had two lots of antibiotics whilst on chemo and it didn't delay anything, in fact my oncologist didn't even seem to be bothered what I had taken, she just looked at my blood results and said it was OK to go ahead x
Posts.Title: Ear infection

Posts.Content: That's a bit rude, not a nice birthday present at all! Wishing you all the best, you will have lots to deal with over the coming months but as you have quoted, it is doable. Listen to your body is key and coming on here really helps xx
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy on my birthday...what a present!

Posts.Content: That's a bit rude, not a nice birthday present at all! Wishing you all the best, you will have lots to deal with over the coming months but as you have quoted, it is doable. Listen to your body is key and coming on here really helps xx
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy on my birthday...what a present!

Posts.Content: I hope that isn't together Mrs pat, prawn sarnies with poached eggs sounds awful x
Posts.Title: Food question.?

Posts.Content: Thank God it isn't just me, I have been hobbling round like a 90 year old, got onc next Wednesday (where he will hopefully tell me that he doesn't want to see me again) so was going to ask as I didn't know if it was because I have been less active during treatment, because I have put weight on and the poor old legs were protesting or whether it was the chemo or even the tamoxifen. Glad to see we are sharing the pain ladies xx
Posts.Title: dodgy knees
